intro: Stenotis peninsularis, commonly known as the Florida bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, showy blooms from late spring to early summer. Stenotis peninsularis is an important plant for local pollinators and is considered a rare species due to habitat loss.
